001package edu.cnm.deepdive.leavemealone.controller;
002
003import android.os.Bundle;
004import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
005import androidx.annotation.Nullable;
006import androidx.fragment.app.Fragment;
007import android.view.LayoutInflater;
008import android.view.View;
009import android.view.ViewGroup;
010import androidx.navigation.NavController;
011import androidx.navigation.Navigation;
012import edu.cnm.deepdive.leavemealone.R;
013import edu.cnm.deepdive.leavemealone.databinding.FragmentControlsBinding;
014
015/**
016 * A simple {@link Fragment} subclass. Use the {@link ControlsFragment#newInstance} factory method
017 * to create an instance of this fragment.
018 */
019public class ControlsFragment extends Fragment {
020
021  private FragmentControlsBinding binding;
022
023  public ControlsFragment() {
024    // Required empty public constructor
025  }
026
027  @Override
028  public View onCreateView(
029      LayoutInflater inflater, ViewGroup container, Bundle savedInstanceState) {
030    binding = FragmentControlsBinding.inflate(inflater, container, false);
031    return binding.getRoot();
032  }
033
034  @Override
035  public void onViewCreated(@NonNull View view, @Nullable Bundle savedInstanceState) {
036    super.onViewCreated(view, savedInstanceState);
037    NavController navController = Navigation
038        .findNavController(view);
039    binding.soundAlarm.setOnClickListener(
040        (v)-> navController.navigate(ControlsFragmentDirections.navigateSounding()));
041    binding.armAlarm.setOnClickListener(
042        (v)-> navController.navigate(ControlsFragmentDirections.navigateArm()));
043    binding.setSecure.setOnClickListener(
044        (v)-> navController.navigate(ControlsFragmentDirections.navigateSecure()));
045    binding.setUnsecure.setOnClickListener(
046        (v)-> navController.navigate(ControlsFragmentDirections.navigateSecure()));
047
048  }
049}
